sen.j: 車折神社駅（くるまざきじんじゃえき）は、京都市右京区嵯峨中又町にある京福電気鉄道京福電気鉄道嵐山本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Kurumazakijinja Station, located in Saga-nakamata-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway station of the Arashiyama Main Line operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Kurumazakijinja Station, located in Saga-nakamata-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway facility of the Arashiyama Main Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Kurumazakijinja Station, located in Saga-nakamata-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway facility of the Arashiyama Main Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 2007年3月18日までの駅名は「車折駅」（くるまざきえき）。
sen.e: The station name before March 18, 2007 was Kurumazaki Station.
Prior to March 18, 2007, it was called Kurumazaki Station.
Prior to March 18, 2007, it was called Kurumazaki Station.
Its station nimber is A11.
Its station number is A11.
Its station number is A11.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: The station has a pair of separate platforms for 2 tracks.
The station has a pair of separate platforms serving two tracks between them.
The station has a pair of separate platforms serving two tracks between them.

sen.j: 駅の柵や柱は車折神社にちなみ朱色に塗られている。
sen.e: The fences and poles of the station are painted vermilion in honor of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine.
The fences and poles of the station are painted vermilion in honor of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine.
The fences and poles of the station are painted vermilion in honor of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 出入り口は嵐山駅方面行きのホームには車折神社の鳥居側に1箇所、四条大宮駅方面行きホームにはホームの両側に2箇所ある。
sen.e: The platform for trains bound for Arashiyama Station has 1 entrance situated on the side of torii (shrine gate) of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine and the platform for trains bound for Shijo-Omiya Station has 2 entrances on both sides of the platform.

The platform for trains bound for Arashiyama Station has one entrance situated on the side of the torii (shrine gate) of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine, while the platform for trains bound for Shijo-Omiya Station has two entrances, one on each side of the platform.

The platform for trains bound for Arashiyama Station has one entrance situated on the side of the torii (shrine gate) of Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine, while the platform for trains bound for Shijo-Omiya Station has two entrances, one on each side of the platform.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）3月25日 嵐山電車軌道の車折駅として開業。
sen.e: March 25, 1910 - The station commenced operation as Kurumazaki Station of Arashiyama Electric Tram Railway.
March 25, 1910: The facility entered operation as Kurumazaki Station of the Arashiyama Electric Tram Railway.
March 25, 1910: The facility entered operation as Kurumazaki Station of the Arashiyama Electric Tramway.
sen.cmt: 嵐山電車軌道→Arashiyama Electric Tramway としました。

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）4月2日 会社合併により京都電燈の駅となる。
sen.e: April 2, 1918 - The station became the station of Kyoto Dento thanks to the merger of the company.
April 2, 1918: The station became a facility of Kyoto Dento, due to the company's merger.
April 2, 1918: The station became a facility of Kyoto Dento, an electric power company, due to the company's merger.
sen.cmt: 京都電燈→Kyoto Dento, an electric power company としました。

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 路線継承により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942 - The station became the station of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. thanks to the succession of the line.
March 2, 1942: The station became a facility of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., based on the succession of the line.
March 2, 1942: The station became a facility of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., based on the succession of the line.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月19日 車折神社駅に改称。
sen.e: March 19, 2007 - The station was renamed Kurumazakijinja Station.
March 19, 2007 - It was renamed as Kurumazakijinja Station.
March 19, 2007: It was renamed as Kurumazakijinja Station.
sen.cmt: コロンに変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 車折神社（芸能の神様として知られる）
sen.e: Kurumazaki-jinja Shrine (it is known as the shrine of public entertainment)
